revision rhinoplasty.context: Revision rhinoplasty and left conchal cartilage harvest to correct nasal deformity.

nasal deformity.context: Revision rhinoplasty and left conchal cartilage harvest to correct nasal deformity.

status post rhinoplasty.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Nasal deformity, status post rhinoplasty.

left conchal cartilage harvest.context: Revision rhinoplasty and left conchal cartilage harvest to correct nasal deformity.

nasal fracture.context: This patient is an otherwise healthy male who had a previous nasal fracture.

hockey puck to the nose.context: During his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.

saddle-nose deformity.context: During his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.

septal hematoma.context: During his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.

Lidocaine with epinephrine.context: The patient did have approximately 12 mL of Lidocaine with epinephrine 1% with 1:100,000 infiltrated into the nasal soft tissues.

cocaine pledgets.context: Cocaine pledgets were placed to assist with hemostasis.

Gore-Tex implant.context: A Gore-Tex small implant had been selected, previously incised.

broad lower lateral cartilages.context: The patient did have very broad lower lateral cartilages leading to a bulbous tip.

bulbous tip.context: The patient did have very broad lower lateral cartilages leading to a bulbous tip.

osteotomies.context: The patient had medial and lateral osteotomies performed with a 2-mm osteotome.

double-dome sutures.context: The patient had a series of double-dome sutures placed into the nasal tip.

intradomal suturing.context: 5-0 Dexon was employed for intradomal suturing

interdomal suturing.context: 5-0 clear Prolene was used for interdomal suturing

alar spanning suture.context: A 5-0 clear Prolene alar spanning suture was employed to narrow the superior tip area.

columella strut.context: The cartilage from the concha was shaped into a strut and placed into a precision pocket between the medial footplate of the lower lateral cartilage.

hemostasis.context: Hemostasis was obtained with bipolar electrocauterization.

bipolar electrocauterization.context: Hemostasis was obtained with bipolar electrocauterization.

Bovie electrocauterization.context: Bovie electrocauterization was also employed as needed.

Telfa.context: A Telfa was placed both anterior and posterior to the conchal defect and placed in a sandwich dressing utilizing a 2-0 Prolene suture.

Prolene suture.context: A Telfa was placed both anterior and posterior to the conchal defect and placed in a sandwich dressing utilizing a 2-0 Prolene suture.

Aquaplast cast.context: The inner nasal area was then examined at the termination of the case and it seemed to be hemostatic as well. The patient had a series of brown Steri-Strips and Aquaplast cast placed over the nasal dorsum.

Steri-Strips.context: The inner nasal area was then examined at the termination of the case and it seemed to be hemostatic as well. The patient had a series of brown Steri-Strips and Aquaplast cast placed over the nasal dorsum.

antibiotics.context: He was charged to home on antibiotics to prevent infection both from the left ear conchal cartilage harvest and also the Gore-Tex implant area.
